tags: i dont know what this is
summary: Buffy to TJ, putting him aside from mixed basketball practice : What is going on man?? You are extremely distracted today, and...
body:
Buffy to TJ, putting him aside from mixed basketball practice : What is going on man?? You are extremely distracted today, and Cyrus is not even here…

TJ with sad demeanor: I know, I´m sorry. It´s just… I like him so much… Do you think he likes me??

Buffy: Seriously dude?? You´ve literally been dating for the past three months

TJ: I know, but it´s just too good to be true…  what if he is doing it to spare my feelings?, I mean, that would be so on brand for him, thinking about others first…  It comes to him as natural as losing one of his shoes whenever we are outdoors - he says with a light chuckle and heart eyes.

Buffy, exasperated, : I can´t with you guys!! Both of you are ridiculous. One of these days my eyes are gonna get stuck from all the rolling they do because of you two!!… Just so you know, and hopefully this will convince you: Yesterday we were talking about math and out of nowhere he pulls out his notebook and starts reading us his vows… his vows for his wedding!!  WITH YOU!!

TJ, pulling out a crumpled paper from his pocket : Really?? Can I read you mine?!

Buffy: …

TJ: My Dear Cy, muffin of my eye…

Buffy, defeated: It´s happening, they are stuck. I´m gonna be blind for the rest of my life…

tags: tbh the friendom just needs some cheering up
summary:
Thought I’d end up with Amber...but she wasn’t a match. 
Wrote some songs about Andi, now I listen and laugh.
Even almost got...
body:
Thought I’d end up with Amber…but she wasn’t a match.


Wrote some songs about Andi, now I listen and laugh.


Even almost got married…



And for Cy I’m so grateful.

Wish I could say thank you to Libby, because she was an angel.

reblog.comment:

summary: On the Cancellation...
body:
On the Cancellation…

Hi Lovelies,

I knew it was coming but the news really hurt, so I’ll take some time and then I’ll formulate a real post, because I love this show with all my heart, and it’s honestly changed my life.

Love,

@ronans-latin-speaking-trees

tags: sorry. im just trying to tag a lot of lgbt shows
summary:
Why you should read the comic Check, Please!
Its an LGBT comic!
It’s about 2 men in love, going through college and their...
body:
Why you should read the comic Check, Please!


  • Its an LGBT comic!

It’s about 2 men in love, going through college and their careers while being lgbt. Also, contrary to some beliefs, it is not a yaoi style comic. The comic focuses on the two men’s relationship and mentions sex very lowkey maybe twice. And it doesn’t just have lgbt men! There’s also a canon lesbian woman, and many extra characters that are all lgbt. Literally an entire group. (you’ll understand once you read it). Even in the 18+ zines, there is both male and female content.

  • It shows a healthy relationship!

The two men have a healthy relationship filled with communication and true love! They work things out and talk. It’s the healthiest lgbt relationship I’ve seen portrayed in media.

  • It shows mental health!

Jack (the second main character) deals with clinical anxiety. (However there is a trigger warning. He overdoses in a flashback but it doesn’t show it. He lives.) Also, there is a character who shows clear symptoms of borderline personality disorder (I’m not sure if it was intentional or not).

  • It shows how one of the characters got out of a past toxic relationship and how he’s dealing with it!

As a person who has been in a toxic relationship like that, it handles it really well. A lot of works of media don’t. The character realizes that the relationship was bad and talks about how neither of them were innocent and that they owe each other a lot of apologies.

  • It is written by an African-American woman!

Ngozi Ukazu is an amazing woman who is so talented! It’s really important to give women (especially women of color) support! Her comic Check Please is the most popular indie comic as well!

  • There’s tons of representation!

Gay! Lesbian! Bi! African-American! African-Canadian! Latino! Asian! Native American! Biracial! Possible Jewish character! A character who comes from a working class family with money problems! Mental illness!

  • Really good coming out scenes!

It’s both positive and bit…not so positive. (Nothing really triggering though). Being a bisexual from the south, it was extremely accurate to my coming out experience (as it was for many others). The other coming out was lowkey and chill and there was so much support.

  • Supportive group of straight (and some not straight) friends!

They are so supportive of their relationship. The love that the whole group of friends have for each other is so special. Some argue that the friends made a “bet” on the character coming out. That is false. The character was already out and they knew the other was lgbt as well. They were betting when they’d say they were a COUPLE.

  • Great world and character building!

Honestly, the experience you get from reading this comic is so surreal. Ngozi is an AMAZING writer. I can not stress that enough. You become so emotionally attached to the characters and world. Every character’s personality is different and well written. Especially for only being written through dialogue.

  • It shows being lgbt in a homophobic community (Hockey/the NHL)!

It shows them navigating that. It shows how the 2 characters are changing hockey for the better. Plus the comic destroys toxic masculinity regarding “hockey bros”.

summary:
Whoop my ass???
But I don’t really care if Tj or Cyrus kiss. Yeah it would be gr8, but as long as they both acknowledge the fact...
body:
Whoop my ass???


But I don’t really care if Tj or Cyrus kiss. Yeah it would be gr8, but as long as they both acknowledge the fact there’s a mutual interest between each other and the confession scene is filled with raw emotions…then I’m good.

reblog.comment:

But I don’t really care if Tj or Cyrus kiss. Yeah it would be gr8, but as long as they both acknowledge the fact there’s a mutual interest between each other and the confession scene is filled with raw emotions…then I’m good.

tags: im so cheesy shut Up rick
summary: an almost-goodbye to andi & co
title: an almost-goodbye to andi & co
body:
im not even going to front with u guys, I’m not okay emotionally, and half of this isn’t coherent, but ive been listening to tomorrow starts today and lemon boy on repeat for half an hour so i am Calm Enough.

so.. andi mack has been, for the past three seasons.. amazing. from the very beginning, just the things they’ve dealt with and even just the way it’s written, not like the way some kids shows are written, like tgey are just doing something, but like they just genuinely want to do something with the story. idk. This show has just made me, as a young teenager, feel like the characters Think Like Me and it really excited me at first! and it still does! and further than that … the rep. i don’t think ive seen rep like this in children’s shows? eve r? (Dont quote me on that) i think there’s something to be said about how, only a few years back, I thought i, as an asian amrrican teenager, wouldn’t ever see myself represented. and then andi came along, and can i just say??? she changed my life? like a lot has gone on in the world and in my life since am first aired, but i would still attribute a lot of credit to it for helping me out with feel proud about my race and culture. and while we’re at it, my sexuality too.

Homestly? i feel like andi mack has paved the way for a lot more in kids shows and that Excites me!!! like im so lucky to grow up now??? but also.. the experience of having andi mack as a part of my life can’t ever be relived. and that makes me so sad. but also.. i can always come back to the show and watch a few episodes.. idk. I’m conflicted. im glad we don’t have to let go just yet.

i guess it’s like the song says? Iike, in the context of rep in kid’s media… the ride has just begun

blog.name: bmgmw
blog.title: it's all about perspective
blog.description: 27. F. Bi. Hodgepodge of AM, GoT, ODAAT, AWAE, GMW, B99, TGP and whatever else I end up getting sucked into 📺ask box open :)

summary: Please say you are sticking around on this blog now that Andi Mack is cancelled. I really like your opinions about shows.
question: Please say you are sticking around on this blog now that Andi Mack is cancelled. I really like your opinions about shows.
answer:
Yes, I’ll still be here. I’ve basically been pretty mutifandom ever since GMW got cancelled. I did post a lot of AM but I’ve never been exclusively AM like how I was exclusively GMW in the beginning.

So yeah I’ll still be posting. Currently watching the last season of GoT and trying to catch up with TGD (but ugh I’m literally still like an entire season behind) so expect some of that.

But ofc I’m always down to talk AM, GMW, and other past shows!

words are nothing in comparison to the amount of love i wanna express i just
summary: So.. I’m busy all week but want to write some stuff about Andi Mack and the friendom. I’ll write more later but let me just...
body:
So.. I’m busy all week but want to write some stuff about Andi Mack and the friendom. I’ll write more later but let me just start rn by saying even though the show has finally been publically announced to end, I’m so proud of everything not only this show has achieved but also that this fandom has achieved.

To the cast, crew, and fandom, though I’m going to eventually try to find the words, there really are none to describe how much love and wellness I want to send to all of you for the future! This show and fandom mean so much to me and just know I love everyone and everything about it with all my heart <3

blog.name: disneymack
blog.title: andi mack trash
blog.description:
sadie. 23. she/they. lesbian. here to talk about tv & give advice. hoodie enthusiast. fandom mother.

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

summary: I don’t really want a season four to be honest I feel like if we got one it wouldn’t be as good as the previous seasons for some...
question: I don’t really want a season four to be honest I feel like if we got one it wouldn’t be as good as the previous seasons for some reason however I’d love for them to do a movie like they did with Lizzie McGuire do you think there would be any chance of one at some point?
answer:
I’ve said all along that from a storytelling perspective, I think I’ll be satisfied with three seasons. Of course I won’t know for sure until we see this last batch of episodes, but I’ve always felt that way. We are so lucky with this season, because it really seems like everyone went into it prepared for it to be the last. Because of that, Terri likely had time to map out where she wanted things to go so that we could get a satisfying ending just in case. And also because of that, nobody else involved in the show held back. The budget for this season was insane, and we see that through the cinematography in every single episode. The cast put on their absolute best performances, and you can tell that their heart went into everything they did this season. Of course there were some really rough obstacles and circumstances that everyone had to overcome, but they were given the opportunity to push through and give this beautiful show the treatment it deserved until the very end. If they had been given the chance to do a season 4, I’m sure it would have been amazing - but I don’t know that they would or could have matched the magic of this season again. 

As for the idea of an Andi Mack movie, I’ve discussed that on here in the past, and my opinion hasn’t really changed. I can’t imagine a scenario in which it could actually work well without cheapening the overall experience of the series. Every single companion film to a Disney Channel series is some sort of stand-alone destination story, usually involving a vacation, because that is one of the only ways to raise the stakes for a TV movie. Lizzie McGuire, Hannah Montana, The Proud Family, Even Stevens, Wizards of Waverly Place - all vacation movies. And truth be told, most of them aren’t that good - especially compared to the actual series. 

There was one really great idea someone had on here awhile back involving Bex leaving Andi and Bowie, and them embarking on a road trip to all of her old hangs to try to track her down. And as a concept, I LOVED that idea. But I don’t trust that the execution would be good enough to make adding a movie onto the end of this series would ever be worth it. We’ve got something special with Andi Mack because it doesn’t have any of the usual gimmicks of a Disney Channel series. I am content without changing that now.
